comment:
Been playing the game for a couple of years, never had any major problems. Tried playing again the last couple of weeks but haven't been able to do so. Every time i start up the game i get the text:

The game crashed
The crash report folder named "2019-02-09_191226" next to game executable.
It would be great if you'd sent it to the developer of the game.

I haven't downloaded any mods or DLC in the last few months since i haven't played the game, so the game is in the same shape it was in when i last played it.

I have removed all mods and tried launching without them but to no avail. I also tried to reinstalle it a couple of times but nothing seems to work. 

Tried to find a solution on the internet but can't seem to find anything. i have copied the crash and outputlog:

crash: https://pastebin.com/HCqJK2Kx 
outputlog: https://pastebin.com/5M9b1Nm1

hope somebody can help me, thank you in advance.
label: Bug
title: Game crashes on startup

comment:
In some zones offline my City buildings spawn and despawn in a loop, while demand is high. That happens just in some districts, not in others. Not things in common I could say.
Cant say if it's just with high density, but It seems so. Problem seems more common with Offices then Commercial. Happens with residentials only in one part of the town.

title: Spawning and despawning buildings

comment:
When I load a map (after editing it in the Map Editor), the map is not the same as the edit map.

I edited/modified Beach Shores so the road coming off the main road is different (changed from two 3-lane roads to two 2-lane roads) and saved the modified map under a different name (Beach Shores modified).

When I load the modified map, the road is still two 3-lanes.
label: Bug
title: [SOLVED] Cities: Skylines (Steam) - Loaded Edited Map Isn't Same as Map I Edited

comment:
The game launches, shows the two startup logos, then crashes.

Attaching gdb to the process:
Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x00000000008ef8b4 in ?? ()
(gdb) bt
#0  0x00000000008ef8b4 in ?? ()
#1  0x0000000000aa299e in ?? ()
#2  0x00000000410c2ad1 in ?? ()
#3  0x0000000002534c40 in ?? ()

Or in another gdb run:
Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x00000000400f8064 in ?? ()
(gdb) bt
#0  0x00000000400f8064 in ?? ()
Backtrace stopped: Cannot access memory at address 0x7ffcf8019ff0

The exact crash location is inconsistent, it doesn't always occur at the same instruction or function.

The crash itself seems to always occur on a write to (%rsp). Plus, at times the stack is smashed and no backtrace is possible. So... it seems you are writing out of bounds on a local array.

I'm a programmer if that helps, I don't mind giving a hand on my end (I really want to try this game!). If the segfault location had been more consistent, I would have dug a little more...

Thanks.
label: Bug
title: Crash on startup after logos, SIGSEV on Linux

I'm not sure if the attached picture has anything to do with the issue, but I don't remember C:S ever having those two icons down bottom. I don't know what its for, but clicking on it does nothing.

title: No Sound in Cities: Skylines
